title: Foundation: A/L in Commerce or Maths
description: A strong background in Commerce (Accounting, Economics, Business Studies) or Maths is ideal. This provides the numerical and analytical foundation required for a career in finance.

title: Degree & Professional Banking Qualification
description: Obtain a degree in Finance, Business Administration, or Economics. Concurrently or subsequently, start professional qualifications like those from the Institute of Bankers of Sri Lanka (IBSL) or a global qualification like CFA.
qualifications: Diploma in Banking & Finance (DBF) from IBSL

title: Banking Officer / Junior Analyst
description: Join a commercial bank or financial institution as a Banking Trainee or Junior Analyst. You will rotate through different departments like retail banking, credit, or treasury to gain broad experience.

title: Financial Analyst / Credit Manager
description: Specialize in a specific area. As a Financial Analyst, you'll analyze stocks, bonds, and other investments for investment banks or asset management firms. As a Credit Manager in a bank, you'll assess the creditworthiness of loan applicants.
institutes: Corporate finance departments of major banks

title: Senior Analyst / Investment Manager / Branch Manager
description: Advance to a senior role, managing investment portfolios, leading teams of analysts, or managing an entire bank branch. An MBA in Finance can be highly beneficial for these leadership positions.
